item.title: 000.Writing Guide
item.description: Dissertation Structure from authoring a phd -see also writing guides writing a scientific paper Writing Format Total writing: < 40k-80k words (~160 pages double-spaced @ 40k, 320 double-spaced @ 80k words) 6 Chapters @ 5-10k words per chapter, (~20-30 pages double-spaced @ 5-8k, single-spaced @ 8-15k) Structure LEAD IN: 1-50/60 pages, 1-2 Chapters. CORE: 50-60 pages, 5 chapters @ 50k words maximum) LEAD OUT (p. 62): 1-2 chapters Should bring together and integrate conclusions from core chapters should cover different compenets of research should “open out” to of results to wider literature, theory and lit discussion saved until end Chapter Organization 10k words/chapter

item.title: 010.Two Narative Arcs + Research Qs
item.description: Two Narative Arcs + Research Qs Research Qs + 2 Narative Arcs and Chapter at-a-glance 2 NARRATIVE ARCS: ICTs construct a present/different/future narrative of Vietnameseness. üåä Main Research Q ‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è How do ICTs mediate experiences of belonging and identity construction of second generation Viet Kieu after return migrating to Viet Nam? Theoretical framework theory.Transnationalism >1. with analysis of imperialism >1.

item.title: 020.Annotated Bibliography
item.description: üå±Annotated Bibliography Annotated bibliography: bib and 2-3 sentences outlining how it connects to research. Organize them by subtopics. Then alphabetically by topic Return Migration 2nd gen return Max muller , returns of german contract workers. Gendered experiences. Similar to my own research! Oxfield and Long. ÔªøLong, Lynellyn D., and Ellen Oxfeld. 2004a. Introduction. In Coming Home? Refugees, Migrants, and Those Who Stayed Behind, ed. Lynellyn D. Long and Ellen Oxfeld, 1‚Äì15.

item.title: 030.Chapters at-a-glance
item.description: Chapters At-a-glance Return of the Vietnamese westerners: Second Generation return migration to Viet Nam in the digital age. Legend | ‚òÄÔ∏è >80% developed | üåä developing | üå± just sprouted üåäPreface and Introduction üß†[Detailed] 031.Chapter1_intro ‚òÄÔ∏èChapter 2 (un)settling home (How second-gen VK ended up in western countries) üß†[Detailed] 032.Chapter2_westerners Introduction (200-1k words) Begin with a qualitative quote? situating within a transnational context Section I: departure: a push from the ancestral homeland (Outward migration of 1st generation from Viet Nam) Pre-1975 (1 wave) Post-1975 (3 waves) Refugee (boat people) orderly departure program (ODP) Humanitarian Operation (HO) Skilled migrants Work migrants (japan today) Hinting at factors that shape return to VN Section II: arrival: born and raised in the West background of western countries statistics of success or failure of viets Terms to Define

item.title: 040.Article Writing
item.description: For [[_Spaces/work/Journals/Journal of Ethnic and Migration Studies]] see: 2022.EuroSEAS_(dan presentation) My ideas for topics [[008.TheoriesAndConcepts/concept.digital ethnic enclave]] #concept social networks. ICTs belongingness outcomes connecting to other expats hegemonic tendencies among western-born viets Discimination and Racism of viets in western countries seen in article by David Mellor in The experiences of Vietnamese in Australia the racist tradition continues #goodmemo #memo while Su and Barber ’s work had elements of non-belonging due to ties with [[001.

item.title: Chapter1_intro
item.description: Chapter1: (Preface? and) Introduction Chapter 1 Introduction (write at the end of dissertation) Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arcs and Chapter at-a-glance Introduction (200-1k words) 0.0 2010s was an unprecedented time for migration. Vietnamese migrants leaving Viet nam in the form of labor migration . Occurring through Regular and irregular channels. Vietnamese diasporic migration into Vietnam. a. 2019 essex lorry incident resulting in 39 deaths brought to the limelight the treacherous nature of international labor migration (Stuart [[005.

item.title: Chapter2_westerners
item.description: Chapter2: The Vietnamese Westerners: Life in the natal home Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arks and Chapters at-a-glance 000.Theories to Employ Section I: The Vietnamese westerner: **(un)settling home (How second-gen Viet Kieu ended up in western countries) Preface/intro: the lack or absence of ICTs in the imaginary of VN while growing up and connecting to VN for the 2nd generation.

item.title: Chapter4: From foreigner to Westerner: (Re)negotiating identity in the ethnic homeland
item.description: Chapter3 The Return from foreigner to Westerner: (Re)negotiating identity in the ethnic homeland The intention of this chapter is to highlight the case study in the current research. The direction is still a work-in-progress and can benefit from a more concentrated approach. The different sections connect directly to the research questions (see link below). Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arcs and Chapter at-a-glance Section I: Inroduction From my #qualitative research: They are outsiders in their birth home and become westerners in their ancestral homeland.

item.title: Chapter5_ICTs
item.description: Chapter4 Transnational virtual networks: Mediating assimilation/acculturation via ICTs #üå± Check out: 2022.EuroSEAS_(dan abstract) 040.Article Writing theme.ICTs and Belonging Research Qs + 2 Narative Arcs Chapter at-a-glance Questions to answer: How do ICTs create a feeling of connectedness to Viet Nam? Do ICTs create connectedness between coethnics and locals? 5.0 Is it technology that binds?

item.title: Chapter6: National Identities, Nation-state, and local perception
item.description: Chapter5 National Identities, the Nation-state and Local perception #üå± Check out: Research Qs + 2 Narative Arks and Chapter at-a-glance 6.1 The State (recognition, Priscila Koh and Recycling Migrations research article) 6.2 citizenship (+visas, on FB groups) 6.2.1 ashley carruther‚Äôs national belonging in transnational fields article. Citizenship makes one belong more or less (p. 426) legal vs performative citizenship (p. 427) 6.3 property ownership
